intro: Diplotaxis tenuisiliqua var. dasycarpa, commonly known as the woolly narrowleaf mustard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that are covered in dense, woolly hairs, giving it its varietal name "dasycarpa." It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. The species is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds.
